meanings.definition: A ritual enclosure that allows observant Jews to carry objects outside their homes on the Sabbath.
meanings.sent1: The eruv in our neighborhood lets us carry things on Saturdays.
meanings.sent2: The eruv was damaged during the storm, so we couldn't carry our groceries.
meanings.sent3: When the eruv fell down, it seemed like our neighborhood was playing a trick on us.
meanings.sent4: The eruv acted like a magical barrier, granting us the freedom to move our belongings.
meanings.sent5: The eruv, like an invisible fence, kept our community connected on the Sabbath.

meanings.definition: The act of creating such an enclosure.
meanings.sent1: The eruv construction took careful planning and teamwork.
meanings.sent2: After the eruv was completed, the community celebrated their accomplishment.
meanings.sent3: The eruv assembly turned into a fun community event, with everyone pitching in.
meanings.sent4: Creating the eruv felt like building a protective shield around the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The eruv's formation symbolized unity and cooperation among the residents.
